intro: Schefflera bougainvilleana, commonly known as the Hawaiian Schefflera, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It features a dense, rounded crown with large, palmate leaves that are dark green and glossy. The plant produces clusters of small, white bracts that surround tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Schefflera bougainvilleana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
